alert.note: Alert for Monroe; Northern Cayuga; Oswego; Wayne (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 27 at 9:56AM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF SOUTHERN OSWEGO AND NORTHERN PARTS OF WAYNE... MONROE...AND CAYUGA COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A band of heavy snow which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. This band of heavy snow is producing extremely heavy snow at the rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 953 AM EDT, a band of heavy snow was across Lake Ontario extending eastward into southern Oswego county near Fulton. The band is moving south at 10 MPH and will enter northern Monroe, Wayne, and Cayuga counties between 10 AM and 11 AM. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Rochester, Irondequoit, Oswego, Fulton, Webster, Fair Haven Beach State Park, Ontario, Williamson, Marion, Central Square, Sodus, Cato, Chimney Bluffs State Park, Battle Island State Park, Brewerton, Hastings, Volney, Constantia, West Monroe and Palermo. This includes Interstate 81 near exit 32. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this band of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. &&
